subtasks: Sit in the driver's seat of the combine harvester
Engage the steering mechanism to turn the combine harvester
Adjust the speed of the combine harvester using the throttle
Monitor the harvester's progress through the field
Operate the combine harvester's cutting mechanism to harvest crops
Collect the harvested crop into the harvester's bin
Monitor the bin's level to avoid overflowing
Operate the combine harvester's threshing mechanism to separate grain from chaff
Control the combine harvester's motor and transmission
Switch between different operational modes of the combine harvester
Position the combine harvester at the grain storage facility
Connect the grain unloading system to the combine harvester
Start the unloading process from the combine harvester to the bin
Monitor the unloading rate and adjust as needed
Transfer the grain from the combine harvester to the storage bin
Ensure the grain is deposited properly into the bin
Check for any blockages or issues during unloading
Inspect the grain in the storage bin for quality
Protect the grain from moisture and pests
Test the moisture content of the grain
Decide when to sell or process the grain based on quality and market conditions
Organize the grain for transportation or further processing
Follow proper storage methods to prevent spoilage
Drive the tractor equipped with a fertilizer spreader
Adjust the spreader settings according to soil and crop needs
Monitor the spreader operation to ensure even distribution
Apply the fertilizer in the correct pattern as per the field's layout
Check for any uneven application or clogs in the spreader
Sit in the driver's seat of the tractor
Engage the steering mechanism to maneuver the tractor through the fields
Operate the clutch and transmission to control the tractor's movement
Adjust the speed and direction of the tractor for efficient work
Manage the engine speed and fuel consumption
Attach农具 to the tractor for various tasks (e.g., plowing, planting)

tasks.task: Securing grain bin from the rain
subtasks: Check for any gaps or openings in the bin's structure
Cover or seal the bin's openings to protect the grain from rain
Install protective covers or tarpaulins over the grain
Monitor the bin's condition during rain to check for leaks
Remove debris from the combine harvester's cutting mechanism
Clean the grain chute and threshing components
Lubricate moving parts of the combine harvester
Check and replace worn or damaged components
Inspect the overall condition of the harvester for any needed repairs

So each of these major activities should be a MAINTASK, and then the subtasks are the component actions within each main task that a person would physically perform.

Then unloading the grain bin would be another MAINTASK. Subtasks here include positioning the harvester, connecting the unloading system, starting the process, monitoring, transferring grain, and ensuring proper deposit.

Managing the grain storage would be another MAINTASK. This includes inspecting grain, protecting from moisture and pests, testing moisture content, deciding when to sell/process, and organizing for transport.
Operating the tractor is a MAINTASK in itself. It includes sitting in the seat, steering, managing speed/direction, controlling engine/fuel, and attaching implements.
Securing the grain bin from rain is another MAINTASK. Subtasks would be checking the bin, covering gaps, using tarps, and monitoring during rain.
Cleaning the combine harvester could be a MAINTASK. Subtasks would include removing debris, cleaning components, lubricating, inspecting, and replacing parts.
